SENT.plain: This paper compares six commonly used QT correction models and three available parameter estimation methods using five indices for QTc evaluation based on real and simulated electrocardiograph (ECG) datasets
The results show that the golden section approach always finds the correction factor making QTc interval uncorrelated to heart rate for all six formulas
However, the correction formulas derived from mixed model sometimes fail to make QTc interval invariant of heart rate
The performance of an individual least-square regression method lies between the golden section iteration approach and the mixed model in terms of QTc-RR relationship
